findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability
findings.explanation: An external call (msg.sender.call.value(_am)()) is made before updating the account balance, allowing the caller to re-enter and drain funds.

findings.title: Access Control vulnerability
findings.explanation: Administrative functions lack any authorization checks (no onlyOwner or require on msg.sender), allowing anyone to set MinSum, set LogFile, or flip the initialized flag.

findings.title: Arithmetic vulnerability
findings.explanation: Unchecked addition on acc.balance (acc.balance += msg.value) and on timestamp (now + _lockTime) can overflow in Solidity 0.4.19, leading to integer overflow vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Denial Of Service vulnerability
findings.explanation: External calls to LogFile.AddMessage can revert or run out of gas, causing the Put and Collect functions to fail and effectively denying service

findings.title: Time Manipulation vulnerability
findings.explanation: The contract uses now (block.timestamp) for critical unlock logic: setting acc.unlockTime in Put and checking now > acc.unlockTime in Collect, which can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Other vulnerability
findings.explanation: Floating pragma (^0.4.19) allows compilation under different minor/patch versions, leading to inconsistent behavior
